subject: Re: [junit] Mocking Static Classes?
msgSnippet: ... Yes many...the other posts are fine examples, plus you could go to the other routes: Replace Static methods with Instance  - in other words instantiate
messageBody:
David Brady wrote:

>We use a bunch of static methods on various classes to provide
>functionality. Today I realized I have no idea how to mock these
>classes. Objects yes, classes no.
>
>Is there a good refactoring to fix this?
>
>

Yes many...the other posts are fine examples, plus you could go to the
other routes:

Replace Static methods with Instance - in other words instantiate your
class that contains the static method and mock the entire thing or just
parts of it.

For most static functions this usually makes more sense because now we
can use polymorphic behavior on the class and the methods. (Biased Point
: I always favour objects over functions - I see more benefits)

I've lost count of the number of times I've had to converts a class of
purely static functions into an class with instance methods.
